description: From narco- +‎ -mania. Coined by Scottish physician Norman Kerr in 1888.

entries.meaning: A pathological craving for or addiction to narcotics or alcohol.
examples: A. S. Sholomovich reported in 1925 that two institutions for child narcotic addicts and eight out-patient clinics for three forms of "narcomania"—alcohol, cocaine, and morphia addiction—were functioning in Moscow.
